frame.name: Communication_noise
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame contains words for types of noise which can be used to characterize verbal communication. It inherits from Communication (possibly more specifically Communication_manner) and the Sound_emission frame (which simply characterizes basic sounds of whatever source, including those made by animals and inanimate objects). As such, it involves a <fen>Speaker</fen> who produces noise and thus communicates a <fen>Message</fen> to an <fen>Addressee</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Message">"Don't treat me as a child!"</fex> <fex name="Speaker">she</fex> <t>cried</t> <fex name="Manner">scornfully</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Speaker">A writer in the Town Planning Review</fex> <t>trumpeted</t> <fex name="Message">that train-sheds were now obsolete</fex>.</ex>
<ex>You know <fex name="Speaker">he</fex> <t>yelled</t> <fex name="Addressee">at Aunt Lou</fex> <fex name="Time">yesterday</fex>, <fex name="Reason">because he slipped on that mat in the hall</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that delivers the <fen>Message</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">Kim</fex> <t>whined</t> that it wasn't fair.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Addressee</fen> refers to the one toward whom the Communication_noise is directed. <fen>Addressee</fen> generally occurs in <ment>to</ment> or <ment>at</ment> PPs.
<ex>Kim <t>whined</t> <fex name="Addressee">to Jess</fex> that it wasn't fair.</ex> <ex>Jess <t>screamed</t> <fex name="Addressee">at Kim</fex> to be quiet.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Message
FE.definition: <def-root>Message has a number of different realizations in this frame, including <ment>that</ment>-clauses, direct quotes, infinitival complements, <ment>for-to</ment> phrases, and NP Objects. <ex>Kim <t>whined</t> <fex name="Message">that it wasn't fair</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Message">"Get moving!"</fex> Jess <t>growled</t>.</ex> <ex>Jess <t>growled</t> at me <fex name="Message">to get moving</fex>.</ex> <ex>Jess <t>growled</t> <fex name="Message">for me to get moving</fex>.</ex> <ex>Jess <t>growled</t> <fex name="Message">an order</fex>.</ex> Quoted <fen>Message</fen>s may either precede or follow the External Argument and verb, or may be discontinuous. <ex><fex name="Msg">"Get moving!"</fex>Jess <t>growled</t>.</ex> <ex>Jess <t>growled</t> angrily <fex name="Msg">"Get moving!"</fex></ex> <ex>"For goodness sake," Jess <t>growled</t>, <fex name="Msg">"get moving!"</fex></ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Topic</fen> occurs in PP Complements, usually headed by <ment>about</ment>.
<ex>Kim <t>howled</t> <fex name="Topic">about the unfairness of it all</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is used for a physical entity or channel that transmits the <fen>Message</fen>. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>on</ment> or <ment>in</ment>.
<ex>Pat <t>screamed</t> something <fex name="Medium">in Spanish</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the state of the <fen>Speaker</fen> during the communication.
<ex>"Get outta here!" he <t>barked</t> <fex name="Dep">unflinching</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Manner</fen> describes the manner or style in which the Communication_noise is delivered.
<ex>"Huh!" he <t>grunted</t> <fex name="Manner">disbelievingly</fex>.</ex> <ex>`"Long , dark hair" he <t>murmured</t> <fex name="Manner">thoughtfully</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Internal_cause
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Communication_noise may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an <fen>Internal_cause</fen>, the <fen>Speaker</fen>'s mental or emotional state. <fen>Internal_cause</fen> is expressed in a PP Complement.
<ex>Kim <t>growled</t> at Tim <fex name="Internal_cause">in frustration</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Voice
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Voice</fen> describes the <fex name="">Speaker'</fex>s utterance or other message-encoded production. <ex><fex name="Voice">John's voice</fex> <t>bellowed</t> for her to be quiet.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.</def-root>

FE.name: Back
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates that the communication act denoted by the target is in response to an earlier communication act in which the roles of Speaker and Addressee were reversed. This is conceptually akin to the Communication_response frame in which the targets themselves denote the responsive nature of the act. </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> where the Communication noise event occurs.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: babble.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: foolish, excited, or confused talk.

lexUnit.name: bark.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: utter (a command or question) abruptly or aggressively

lexUnit.name: bawl.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shout out noisily or angrily

lexUnit.name: bellow.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to communicate a statement using a loud, deep voice

lexUnit.name: bleat.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak or complain in a weak or foolish way.

lexUnit.name: bray.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: issue a loud, harsh cry.

lexUnit.name: burble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak unintelligibly and at unnecessary length.

lexUnit.name: cackle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: talk inconsequentially and at length.

lexUnit.name: chirp.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something in a lively and cheerful way.

lexUnit.name: chirrup.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make repeated short high-pitched sounds.

lexUnit.name: chuckle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: laugh quietly or inwardly.

lexUnit.name: cluck.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: express fussy concern about.

lexUnit.name: coo.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a person) speak in a soft gentle voice.

lexUnit.name: croak.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: utter a croak.

lexUnit.name: croon.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to speak in a soft, low voice

lexUnit.name: crow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: utter its characteristic loud cry.

lexUnit.name: cry.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shout or scream loudly.

lexUnit.name: drone.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a continuous low humming sound.

lexUnit.name: gasp.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: catch one's breath with an open mouth, owing to pain or astonishment.

lexUnit.name: grate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make an unpleasant rasping sound.

lexUnit.name: groan.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a deep inarticulate sound in response to pain or despair.

lexUnit.name: growl.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something in a low grating voice.

lexUnit.name: grunt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a low, short guttural sound.

lexUnit.name: gurgle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a hollow bubbling sound.

lexUnit.name: hiss.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a sharp sibilant sound as of the letter s, often as a sign of disapproval or derision.

lexUnit.name: hoot.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: express loud scornful disapproval of something.

lexUnit.name: howl.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a howling sound.

lexUnit.name: moan.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: utter or make a moan.

lexUnit.name: murmur.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something in a murmur (low, continuous sound)

lexUnit.name: purr.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to speak in a manner that resembles a cat's purr

lexUnit.name: rap.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something sharply or suddenly.

lexUnit.name: rasp.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a harsh, grating noise.

lexUnit.name: rattle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or cause to make a rapid succession of short, sharp knocking or clinking sounds.

lexUnit.name: roar.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or utter a roar.

lexUnit.name: rumble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a continuous deep, resonant sound.

lexUnit.name: scream.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a long, loud, piercing cry or sound, especially expressing extreme emotion or pain.

lexUnit.name: screech.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a screech.

lexUnit.name: shriek.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: utter a high-pitched piercing sound, cry, or words.

lexUnit.name: shrill.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: utter or send out (a song, complaint, etc.) shrilly

lexUnit.name: snarl.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something aggressively.

lexUnit.name: snort.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a snort.

lexUnit.name: splutter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say in a rapid indistinct way.

lexUnit.name: sputter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak in a series of incoherent bursts.

lexUnit.name: squawk.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something in a loud, discordant tone.

lexUnit.name: squeak.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something in a high-pitched tone.

lexUnit.name: squeal.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something in a high-pitched, excited tone.

lexUnit.name: thunder.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak loudly, angrily, and forcefully, especially to protest:

lexUnit.name: titter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give a titter.

lexUnit.name: trill.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: speak producing a quavering or warbling sound; sing or pronounce with a trill

lexUnit.name: trumpet.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: proclaim widely or loudly.

lexUnit.name: twitter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: talk rapidly in a nervous or trivial way.

lexUnit.name: wail.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: manifest or feel deep sorrow for; lament.

lexUnit.name: warble.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: speak in a trilling or quavering voice

lexUnit.name: wheeze.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: speak with a whistling or rattling sound in the chest

lexUnit.name: whimper.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: communicate fear, pain or discontent making a series of low, feeble sounds

lexUnit.name: whine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: complain in a feeble or petulant way.

lexUnit.name: whoop.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give or make a whoop.

lexUnit.name: yell.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shout in a loud or piercing way.

lexUnit.name: yelp.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: communicate or speak with yelps
